intro: Seseli dulce, commonly known as sweet seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, white or yellowish flowers that bloom in umbrella-like clusters. Native to the Mediterranean region, it thrives in dry, sunny environments. The plant is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand arid conditions. Its aromatic properties make it a notable species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
